sen.j: 一には功の多少を計（はか）り彼（か）の来処（らいしょ）を量（はか）る。
sen.e: Firstly, I offer my sincerest gratitude to many people who took pains to prepare this meal.

sen.j: 二には己が徳行（とくぎょう）の全欠を［と］忖（はか）つて供（く）に応（おう）ず。
sen.e: Secondly, I ask myself if my deeds are worthy of eating this meal.
Second, I ask myself if my deeds are worthy of my eating this meal.
Second, I ask myself if my deeds are worthy of my eating this meal.

sen.j: 三には心を防ぎ過（とが）を離るることは貪等（とんとう）を宗（しゅう）とす。
sen.e: Thirdly, I swear never to be greedy in order to keep a well-balanced mind and to avoid wrongdoings.
Third, I swear never to be greedy in order to keep a well-balanced mind and avoid wrongdoings.

sen.j: 四には正に良薬を事とすることは形枯（ぎょうこ）を療（りょう）ぜんが為なり。
sen.e: Fourthly, I will have this meal as a good medicine to keep my health and to gain energy.
Fourthly, I will have this meal as a good medicine to keep my health and gain energy.

sen.j: 五には成道（じょうどう）の為の故に今此（いまこ）の食（じき）を受く。
sen.e: Fifthly, I will have this meal to carry out the Buddha's teachings rightly.
Fifthly, I will have this meal in order to correctly carry out the Buddha's teachings.
